snippet: The measure authorizes further military action against Syria, as Turkey began its second day of shelling targets across the border in response to a mortar attack that killed five civilians.
abstract: Turkey’s Parliament authorizes further military action against Syria as Turkish forces fire a second round of artillery across the border, in response to Syrian mortar attack that killed five civilians; actions threaten to escalate a confrontation that has highlighted Turkey’s fraught double role as it tries to stay out of direct involvement in fight against Pres Bashar al-Assad while offering haven and support to rebels.

byline.original: By TIM ARANGO and HWAIDA SAAD
byline.contributor: Tim Arango reported from Istanbul, and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon. Reporting was contributed by Sebnem Arsu from Istanbul; Hala Droubi, Hania Mourtada and Anne Barnard from Beirut; and Neil MacFarquhar from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: The measure authorizes further military action against Syria, as Turkey began its second day of shelling targets across the border in response to a mortar attack that killed five civilians.

headline.seo: Turkey’s Parliament Approves Further Military Action Against Syria
headline.main: Turkey’s Parliament Backs Military Measures on Syria
headline.print_headline: Turkey’s Parliament Backs Military Measures on Syria
